title: Prophetic Hope
objective: Identify restoration promises in prophetic literature

segments.audio_script: This is lesson twenty-two. You are studying prophetic hope. Lesson twenty-one examined covenant curse and exile.
Even during exile, prophets promise restoration. God will not abandon covenant people. New covenant is promised. Internal transformation will mark restoration.
Jeremiah 31 promises new covenant written on hearts. Ezekiel 36 promises new spirit within Israel. Restoration is not mere return to land. It involves spiritual renewal and covenant restoration.
Key themes: new covenant is God's future commitment. Restoration is both external and internal. God promises not to abandon covenant people. Hope persists despite judgment.
What does God promise in the new covenant?
segments.correct_answer: God's law written on people's hearts

segments.audio_script: This completes lesson twenty-two. You studied prophetic hope. Next lesson examines return and rebuilding.

vocabulary.definition: God's promised future covenant marked by internal transformation and permanent relationship
God's return of exiled people to land and renewal of covenant relationship

study_notes: Prophetic promises of new covenant form bridge to New Testament. Jesus is presented as inaugurator of new covenant.
